answers.answer: It is terribly difficult to continue to press through the medical world to eventually get diagnosed.  This is a common theme that many of us have been through.  It does sound like you are having alot of neuropathy of unknown orogin.MS can take over a year to diagnose.  Have you had a spinal tap?  Do you know if there is any degenerative disc disease or stenosis.  Sometimes that can happen even though you are fit and active.You mentioned your concern about poor prognosis because of agegroup.  Are you worried about primary progressive MS?  Are there other symptoms like fatigue, balance, weakness?Red

I haven't had a spinal tap.  My neurologist hasn't suggested I get one.  He also doesn't believe a second MRI would be of any value at this stage.I am kind of worried about primary progressive MS, simply because of my age.  I also don't have any history of any symptoms that could have been MS in the past.  That said, I am kind of relying on statistics for this and realise that the changes of me actually having primary progressive MS are very slim.  But it's still not ruled out.I don't have any other symptoms.  My balance is fine, and I don't have any eye symptoms or fatigue.  It's really just the parasthesia and pains in my foot.  Apart from these symptoms I feel fine.

question: HiI've been having symptoms of paresthesia in my feet, legs and left hand/arm for the past 6 months.  I also have some numbness in my little toe on my left foot and sporadic pain in the left foot.I used to run a lot, but find that if I run at all, I get pains in my left foot and it takes me days for them to return to the level they were before the run.The parasthesia in my feet tends to be worse when wearing socks and shoes.  I also have good days and bad days.  A good day is where I almost don't notice it, but it is always there. A bad day is when it drives me to distraction and causes me to become quite stressed.I've had a brain, cervical and thoracic mri and all where clear.  I've had 2 emg's, and both were clear.  I've had all kinds of prodding and other tests by my neurologist and all were fine.  I've had pretty much every blood test the Drs. can think of and all have come back negative (b12, diabetes, lymes, syphilis etc.)My Neurologist has discharged me for now, and said he didn't think it was anything nasty like MS or diabetes. He did mention Poly Neuropathy but I'm said he only suspected that and didn't seem sure.  Particularly as the Emg's couldn't find anything.I'm male and in my early 40's.  I'm otherwise quite fit as I have trained for and ran several triathlons over the past few years.Has anybody had similar symptoms and had a diagnosis of some kind?  I'm still concerned it could be MS, and being over 40 I'm also worried that the prognosis for this age group is less favourable.
title: Parasthesia in legs, feet and hands for 6 months.
